titleText: Microsoft finally kills off the Kinect, but the tech will live on in other devices
mainText: Microsoft’s Kinect had a rapid ascent and slow, sputtering demise — it was an inelegant end, as the company couldn’t find a permanent spot for the once revolutionary accessory. Now Microsoft is finally ready to.

titleText: Microsoft stops manufacturing its Kinect sensors
mainText: Microsoft has stopped making Kinect sensors seven years after releasing its first model in 2010. Microsoft officials confirmed to Fast Co Design on October 25 that manufacturing of Kinect has officially shut down. Microsoft officials said.

titleText: Microsoft is now trying to use Google's secret cloud weapon against it
mainText: Microsoft unveiled the Azure Container service, (AKS), which uses Kubernetes, a software project invented by Google. Google uses Kubernetes as a major selling point for its own Google Cloud, but Microsoft and the market-leading Amazon Web.

titleText: Microsoft introduces a free, dedicated Azure Container Service for Kubernetes
mainText: Microsoft's current Azure Container Service (ACS) for developing, deploying and maintaining containers has supported Kubernetes since early 2017. Kubernetes has emerged as the open-source container orchestration standard. Microsoft says its Kubernetes support on ACS has grown.

titleText: Xbox One consoles could support premium wireless speakers
Microsoft's new studios create Mixed Reality holograms
mainText: Microsoft is opening its first Mixed Reality capture studios in San Francisco and London, allowing developers and creators to create holograms from real life objects. Microsoft has been using its own studio at its Redmond.

titleText: Microsoft Teams will get Skype for Business features in Q2 2018
mainText: Last month, Microsoft announced Microsoft Teams will replace Skype for Business and become the core communications client in Office 365, but didn’t provide a timeframe. Today the company released its roadmap for this change and.
